sentence: I stood at the top of the stairs while German planes flew back and forth, and I knew I was on my own, that I couldn’t count on others for support.
All I want to do is scream “Let me be, leave me alone!” Who knows, perhaps the day will come when I’m left alone more than I’d like!
Another Sunday has rolled around; I don’t mind them as much as I did in the beginning, but they’re boring enough.
Father has noticed I’m not my usual self, but I can’t tell him what’s bothering me.
I still haven’t gone to the warehouse yet, but maybe sometime soon.
I looked up at the sky and trusted in God.
Last night I went downstairs in the dark, all by myself, after having been there with Father a few nights before.
I have an intense need to be alone.
